channel.title: Telecom Bandwidth on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Telecom Bandwidth on 0x000216

item.title: Ethernet Services over Copper
item.description: Connecting networks logically often involves Ethernet, a technology that has recently expanded its reach beyond local boundaries. Ethernet over Copper (EoC) connections are increasing in availability and often come at a lower cost compared to other options. EoC enables standard Ethernet services to be delivered through existing copper telephone wiring. Unlike typical Cat 5E or Cat 6 wiring, EoC is compatible with older copper infrastructure not initially intended for Ethernet.

item.title: How Growing Companies Buy Bandwidth
item.description: As businesses recover and grow, they’ll need more resources. But with economic uncertainty, it’s wise to expand cautiously. Is that even possible with bandwidth? Yes, it is. Traditional telecom contracts lock you into a service level for 1 to 3 years. For example, a T1 line provides a fixed 1.5 Mbps bandwidth for a monthly fee. Doubling bandwidth means another T1 line. These lines can be ‘bonded’ for combined bandwidth, either by the provider or using devices like Mushroom Networks’ “Truffle.
